title: 2015 Countdown Problem #26: Trig-gy Trigonometry
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/solvable/830a6063be.fa6af6e97d.y56enM.jpg?width=250"}},{"type":"text","text":"
Consider the following two functions:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)=1860\sin(\frac{2\pi x}{2015})"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"g(x)=775\cos(\frac{2\pi x}{2015})"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"When the graph "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y=f(x)+g(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is plotted against the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" axes, the resulting trigonometric graph has an amplitude of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\alpha"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", a period of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\beta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and a y-intercept of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\gamma"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Also, the negative "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"-intercept of the graph nearest to the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"-axis can be expressed as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{\sigma}{\pi}  \tan^{-1}{\epsilon}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sigma"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is an integer."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Determine the value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"-\frac{\beta\sigma}{\alpha\gamma{\epsilon}^2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is part of the set 2015 Countdown Problems.","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]}]}

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)+g(x) = 1860\sin(\frac{2\pi x}{2015})+775\cos(\frac{2\pi x}{2015}) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= \sqrt{{1860}^2+{775}^2}\sin(\frac{2\pi x}{2015} + \tan^{-1} {(\frac{775}{1860}))}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=2015\sin(\frac{2\pi x}{2015} + \tan^{-1} {(\frac{5}{12}))}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hence
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\alpha=2015"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\beta=2015"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" , "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\gamma=775"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"To find the required "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"-intercept we need to solve"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sin(\frac{2\pi x}{2015} + \tan^{-1} {(\frac{5}{12}))}=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"By considering special angles you would arrive at"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=-\frac{2015 \tan^{-1}{(\frac{5}{12})}} {2\pi}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"u=\frac{1}{2} \tan^{-1} \frac{5}{12}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\tan^{-1} \frac{5}{12}=2u"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{5}{12}=\tan{2u}=\frac{2\tan u}{1-\tan^{2} u}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"By considering the quadratic equation you would arrive at"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"-intercept="},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(-\frac{2015}{\pi}) \tan^{-1}(\frac{1}{5}) \Rightarrow \sigma=-2015, \epsilon=\frac{1}{5}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"-\frac{\beta \sigma}{\alpha \gamma {\epsilon}^2}=-\frac{-(2015)^2}{(2015)(775)(\frac{1}{5})^2}=65"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 2015 Countdown Problem #3: An A-maze-ing Maze
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/solvable/830a6063be.bcc4d4f038.LDbJxP.png?width=250"}},{"type":"text","text":"
An ant wishes to travel from point A to point B along the black lines in the maze shown below. The ant can only either travel upwards and rightwards, and cannot cross any of the grey zones in the maze. Calculate the number of ways the ant can travel between the two points."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Clarification: The ant travels along the black lines and not along the white squares as a whole. After all, it starts and ends at two predetermined points A & B (which aren't squares).","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is part of the set 2015 Countdown Problems.","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"There are 5 white-square ways"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"First way is 7 squares up and 17 right > (1x6x17 + 1 + 17) ways"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Second way is 5 squares right ,7 squares up and 13 right > (5x6x13 + 5 + 13) ways"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Third way is 9 squares right ,7 squares up and 9 right > (9x6x9 + 9 + 9) ways"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Fourth way is  squares right ,7 squares up and 13 right > (13x6x5 + 13 + 5) ways"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Fifth way is 17 squares right and 7 squares > (17x6x1 + 17 + 1) ways"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Adding all up gives 1560 ways"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"we can solve this problem with DP bottom up approach,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"cell(i,j) = cell(i-1,j) + cell(i,j-1)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"initially, cell(1,0) = cell(0,1) = 1"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"like this one: http://s5.postimg.org/d8httfhmf/image.jpg"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

title: 2015 Countdown Problem #4: Find the Largest - Part I
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Which of the following is the largest?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A. "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt{2^{11}\sqrt{2^{11}\sqrt{2^{11}\sqrt{2^{11}\sqrt{...}}}}}-"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt{33\sqrt{33\sqrt{33\sqrt{33\sqrt{...}}}}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"B. "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{1}{2}+\frac{1}{1+2014^{-2014}}+\frac{1}{1+2013^{-2013}}+\frac{1}{1+2012^{-2012}}+..."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"+\frac{1}{1+2012^{2012}}+\frac{1}{1+2013^{2013}}+\frac{1}{1+2014^{2014}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"C. "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1008\times(1-\frac{1}{2^{2}})^{-1}\times(1-\frac{1}{3^{2}})^{-1}\times(1-\frac{1}{4^{2}})^{-1}..."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(1-\frac{1}{2013^{2}})^{-1}\times(1-\frac{1}{2014^{2}})^{-1}\times(1-\frac{1}{2015^{2}})^{-1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Sum = "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{1}{2}+2014×1+\frac{1}{2} = 2015"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=1008(\frac{2}{3}×\frac{3}{4}×…×\frac{2014}{2015}×\frac{2015}{2016})(\frac{2}{1}×\frac{3}{2}×…×\frac{2014}{2013}×\frac{2015}{2014})"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

title: 2015 Countdown Problem #5: Multiplication Madness

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Each product is a factor of the final product. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"First we look at if the answer is positive or negative. 
Positive factors always have a positive product. The first two products are positive. 
An odd number of negative factors have a negative product, and the reverse is also true. Hence 2017 negative numbers have a negative product and 2018 negative numbers have a positive product. Since an odd number of negative factors have a negative product, and there is only one negative factor, the answer must be negative. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Then we find out if the answer is odd or even. Out of the four products, three are odd and one is even. Since one factor is even, the answer must be even. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hence the answer is a negative even number. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Sorry if I used too many words."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/solvable/830a6063be.7196b5875f.XojhBm.png?width=250"}},{"type":"text","text":"
Last year I've posted the following problem "},{"type":"text","text":"(Summing up the Years)","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" which has been reshared on Brilliant's official Facebook page, and this year I've decided to introduce a twist to this deceptively simple problem:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the last digit of
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \sum_{i=0}^{2015} ( ((2015^{i})^{i}) (i^{2015}) ) "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is part of the set 2015 Countdown Problems.","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]}]}

Every term other than the term we can ignore is divisible by 5."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"i^{2015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is odd if and only if "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"i"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is odd, and multiplying by an odd number doesn't change its parity.  Therefore, every odd term is odd and all other terms are even.  There are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{2015+1}{2}=1008"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" odd terms, so their sum is even, so the entire sum is even."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore the entire sum is divisible by 5 and even, so it is divisible by 10, so its last digit is 0."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

Hence the last digit of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{(2015)}^i"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"=5, simplifying the sun to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5\sum_{i=1}^{2015} {i^{2015}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" . It can be further simplified to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5\sum_{i=1}^{2015} {(last-digit-of-i)}^{2015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0≤i≤9"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the last digits of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"i^k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is an integer are tabulated below (note the pattern):"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Note that 2015=3 (mod 4)=1 (mod 2)=5 (mod 10). Hence,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0^{2015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"=0 (mod 10),"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1^{2015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"=1 (mod 10),"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^{2015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"=2^{3 (mod 4)}=8 (mod 10),"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3^{2015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"=3^{3 (mod 4)}=7 (mod 10),"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4^{2015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"=4^{1 (mod 2)}=4 (mod 10),"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5^{2015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"=5 (mod 10),"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"8^{2015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"=8^{3 (mod 4)}=2 (mod 10), and"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"9^{2015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"=9^{1 (mod 2)}=9 (mod 10). "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, the last digit"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

title: 2015 Countdown Problem #7: Cardinal Number Lengths
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/solvable/830a6063be.7196b5875f.SExYl1.png?width=250"}},{"type":"text","text":"
For every integer "},{"type":"text","text":"0<N≤2015","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":", let "},{"type":"text","text":"f(N)","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":" denote the number of letters when N is spelt in English."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For example, 77 is spelt “"},{"type":"text","text":"seventy seven","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"”, hence "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(77)=7+5=12"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f^2 (77)=f(12)=6"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Also, 2015 is spelt “"},{"type":"text","text":"two thousand and fifteen","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"”, hence "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(2015)=3+8+3+7=21"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Determine the value of
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sum_{N=1794}^{2015} (\lim _{ k\rightarrow \infty  }{ f^ { k}  (N) } )"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is part of the set 2015 Countdown Problems.","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]}]}

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We first set the boundaries at "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0<N≤9"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Also, note that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\max⁡(f(N))=5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f^{-1} (\max⁡{(f(N))} )=f^{-1} (5)="}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"3,7 or 8 (meaning that the longest spelt numbers from 1 to 9 are “"},{"type":"text","text":"three","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"”, “"},{"type":"text","text":"seven","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"” and “"},{"type":"text","text":"eight","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"” at 5 letters long). With some work it can be deduced that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\lim_{k→∞}⁡{f^k (N)}=4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0<N≤9"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We now expand the boundary to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0<N≤99"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Observe that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\max{⁡(f(N))}=7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" when "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(N)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a multiple of 10 (meaning that the longest spelt multiple of 10 is “"},{"type":"text","text":"seventy","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"” at 7 letters long). Hence for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0<N≤99"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\max⁡(f(N))=7+5=12"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f^{-1} (\max{⁡(f(N))} )=f^{-1} (12)="}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"77 or 78 (meaning that the longest spelt 2-digit numbers are ""},{"type":"text","text":"seventy seven","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"" and ""},{"type":"text","text":"seventy eight","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"" at 12 letters long). Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(N)≤12"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", it can be determined that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f^2 (N)≤f(12)≤6<9"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", implying that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\lim_{k→∞}⁡{f^k (N)}=4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0<N≤99"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"When we expand the boundary all the way to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0<N≤2015"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" as stated in the question, it is clear that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(N)≤99"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (meaning that any spelt number from 1 to 2015 is clearly less than 100 letters long; for observation note that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\max⁡(N)=38"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" occurs when "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N=1777"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"). Therefore,
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\lim_{k→∞}⁡{f^k (N)}=4 \mbox{ } \forall \mbox{ } 0<N≤2015"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"As such,
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sum_{N=1794}^{2015}(\lim_{k→∞}⁡{f^k (N)}) =
\sum_{N=1794}^{2015}(4) =(2015-1794+1)(4)=888"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 2015 Countdown Problem #8: Factoring 2015 Squared

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If No. = a^p × b^q × c^r then distinct divisors/factors of No are (p + 1)(q + 1)(r + 1)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2015^² = 5^2×13^2×31^2  "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"distinct divisors/factors of 2015² = (2 + 1)(2 + 1)(2 + 1) = 27"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
